answers.answer: It's common to fail the 1 hour and then pass the 3 hour??
Yes alot of women fail the 1 hr one and then pass 3 hour one. Good luck though!
Okay. I hope so! Thank you!!
Just failed my 1 hour test last Thursday then passed the 3 hour that Saturday. No need to stress, every told me it is normal. My mom failed her 1 hour glucose test with all four of us.
I failed my 1 hour with my first child and passed the 3 hour. I wouldn't be too worried.
I just found out i just failed my 1 hr test by .1 :( kinda ***** now i might need to do a 2 hr test.  Hopefully dont gave gestational diabetes.
Any tips for not failing? I have to do it next week
I fasted for both of them as told by my doctor. But I am happy to report that I passed my 3 hour test! Woo hoo! Was worried about diabetes for a bit.

We have to fast for 12hrs, get lucozade, wait 2hrs and get tested again. My blood glucose level was at 5.0 during fast and elevated to 8.2 (norm is up to 7.8). Here we get referred to diet changing classes and check our blood glucose over a 2wk period and then retested. I'm not sure if the test results is a true reflection of what happens? I mean, the level of glucose in lucozade is high and this drink isn't a natural product and contains loads of other artificial stuff. My normal diet also doesn't contain as much sugar or starchy stuff, so I wonder about this test. Hopefully with dietary changes my results will look better.

question: I took my glucose test yesterday and it was the 1 hour one and my levels were elevated apparently. So now I have to go back and take the 3 hour one on Monday. Has anybody had experience with this where they failed the 1 hour and passed the 3 hour?  I'm worried and just want to pass it.Thanks
title: glucose test
